Detailed Description

Physics Engine for the Games Gem 4 chapter "Creating a Verlet Based Physics Engine".

Member Function Documentation

uint32 Physics::Engine::AddRigidBodyPlane (  PMath::Plane &  plane  ) 
 

create a rigid body and add it to the physics engine Adds body at rest, at the origin, and with default properties

Returns:
the unique ID of the new rigid body

uint32 Physics::Engine::AddSpring (   ) 
 

create a spring and add it to the system

Returns:
unique ID of the new spring

bool Physics::Engine::RemoveRigidBody (  uint32  id  ) 
 

Removes a rigid body from the simulation. Does nothing if the specified id doesn't exist

Parameters:
id id of the body to remove
Returns:
true if successfully removed

void Physics::Engine::Render (   ) 
 

Intended for debugging use only

void Physics::Engine::SetCollisionCallback (  ICallback *  pCB  ) 
 

Sets a collision callback object. Note that the object is owned by the application, not the physics engine, and will not be deleted by the physics engine. It is illegal to call any physics engine functions from the callback.

Parameters:
pCB The callback object to use when collisions occur.

void Physics::Engine::SetGravity (  PMath::Vec3f  val  ) 
 

Set the gravity vector that applies to all bodies, if body's gravity flag is true

Parameters:
val Gravity vector. Generally, z is positive up.

void Physics::Engine::Simulate (  Real  dt  ) 
 

Run one step of the simulation.

Parameters:
dt the time period, in seconds, of the current simulation frame
